sentence.Network_en: The teacher used to beguile her pupils with fairy tales.
sentence.Network_cn: 这位教师常常给她的学生讲童话故事,借以吸引他们的兴趣.

sentence.Network_en: Nothing can beguile the old man.
sentence.Network_cn: 什么也欺骗不了这位老人.

sentence.Network_en: Games are usually used to beguile small children.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (in the sense 'deceive, deprive of by fraud'): from be- 'thoroughly' + obsolete guile 'to deceive' (see guile)

entry.def: If something beguiles you, you are charmed and attracted by it.

example.ex: His paintings beguiled the Prince of Wales...
example.tran: 他的画把威尔士亲王给迷住了。

example.ex: I was beguiled by the romance and exotic atmosphere of the souks in Marrakech.
example.tran: 我被马拉喀什露天市场的浪漫情调和异域风情深深地吸引了。

entry.def: If someone beguiles you into doing something, they trick you into doing it.

example.ex: He used his newspapers to beguile the readers into buying shares in his company.
example.tran: 他利用他的报纸诱骗读者买他公司的股票。

auth_sentence.content: But Keys' canny ability to fox and beguile make The Element of Freedom an unexpected pleasure.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Keys' canny ability to fox and beguile make The Element of Freedom an unexpected pleasure.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Keys' canny ability to fox and beguile make The Element of Freedom an unexpected pleasure.

auth_sentence.content: Yet at his best he could render dreams on film with a gossamer-light facility that continues to beguile us.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yet at his best he could render dreams on film with a gossamer-light facility that continues to beguile us.

auth_sentence.content: He was close to his Norwegian mother, a mystic who would beguile her son with the dark, yet humorous fairytales of her homeland.

sentences.cn: 这位教师常常给她的学生讲童话故事，借以吸引他们的兴趣。

sentences.en: They are playing cards to beguile the time.
sentences.cn: 他们在打牌以消磨时间。

sentences.en: Nothing can beguile the old man.
sentences.cn: 什么也欺骗不了这位老人。
